title: MiliMil
author: MiliMil
content: I've created a Discord channel where 30 people have joined in the last 2 days.I want to create an online community where we can encourage each other and share daily tips and betting strategies.I have posted 5 tips so far and 4 have won.I'll be posting my big wins and losses there (similar to what I've shared on this forum).There is a lot of money to be made in the next few months with the NBA Finals and French Open.It is 100% free with no fees.Link: https://discord.com/invite/beUm75Ft

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: You could always use this thread and do the same thing. People don't mind a tipster on the forum, but they may not want to join a new discord. It's just easier to login to 1 thing IMO.

comments.author: Fesatmas
comments.body: It might be a good step to have a more intense community in terms of communication discussing tricks and tips or strategies in gambling, but I think if you can share it in this forum like what @yahoo62278 said why not with that and we don't need to go into it your discord group.I'm quite interested in betting strategies, because to be honest I myself don't have a specific strategy in gambling that gives a higher average win, but if it's just sharing complaints and wins and tricks in general I think what's the difference with other communities.

comments.author: madnessteat
comments.body: Many people think that communicating in Discord is much more convenient than on the forum, but I also think that many of those who constantly communicate on this forum probably would not want to switch to a third-party server Discord. And there are several reasons for that - many of us are used to open communication, the forum already has a reputation system, many people simply can't stand Discord.

comments.author: wiss19
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on April 08, 2023, 04:07:04 PMYou could always use this thread and do the same thing. People don't mind a tipster on the forum, but they may not want to join a new discord. It's just easier to login to 1 thing IMO. Since as you said, a lot of users would probably not want to join a different platform to get the tips or participate in discussions related to them, so maybe it would be a good idea if OP shares his tips on both places. He has created the server and people have joined too, and some more may join later, but those who don't want to do that will be able to get the tips right from here.Tipsters have always been welcome in the forum, especially those who have a good track record and an impressive win ratio since OP mentioned he had 4 wins out of 5 bets recently, that would have been interesting if they were posted here too.
